The First Step to Becoming a Digital Nomad Is Finding The Right Company

I am so grateful to work for a company that is 100% remote. In the past few months, I’ve had so many people I know, either on Twitter or at a coffee shop, ask me how working remotely is possible.

In my case, it’s always been a goal of mine. When I graduated University, I turned down two full-time job offers that would have kept me in one place and took off to Colombia to freelance remotely.

I ended up applying to Buffer a company that had always stood out to me as incredible in a million ways, from the salary transparency to the emphasis on customer service (in addition to the whole team being remote!).

I am so grateful to have met incredible people on the Buffer team. It ended up being a good fit on both sides and I’m ever grateful to now be able to call the Buffer team my family. ❤

So how can you find your remote team and take off as a digital nomad? Well, a remote job hunt is almost the same as a any other job hunt. The only differences being:

  1. You have to focus on finding companies that are hiring remote workers (which is where this list comes in extra handy!)
  2. You might not meet anyone from the team in person until after you’ve been hired; and
  3. You have to be comfortable and productive working in your own space, whether that’s your home, a coworking spot or a coffee shop.

Would love to hear about your journey to digital nomadia, are you working remotely or currently applying to remote positions? :)
